{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient presents with a severe headache that is 10/10 in intensity, associated with chewing, and described as a dull pain over the sides of her head. The pain worsens when opening and closing her mouth, which suggests involvement of the jaw muscles or joints. This pattern of symptoms, particularly the temporal and mandibular tenderness, points towards Temporomandibular Joint (TMJ) dysfunction.", "answer_choice": "C"}
